classes.name: ArrayBuffer
classes.comment: This class manages ARRAY_BUFFER type buffers.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this ArrayBuffer belongs to

params.name: data
params.comment: The data to fill the buffer with, or the size (in bytes)

params.name: usage
params.comment: The usage hint for this buffer (`GL_STATIC_DRAW`, `GL_DYNAMIC_DRAW`, etc.)

params.name: glbuffer
params.comment: A WebGLBuffer to use instead of creating a new one

properties.name: attribs
properties.comment: The attributes declared for this buffer

properties.name: buffer
properties.comment: The webgl buffer this ArrayBuffer writes to

properties.name: byteLength
properties.comment: The length in bytes of the buffer

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this ArrayBuffer belongs to

properties.name: length
properties.comment: The number of vertices in the buffer data

properties.name: stride
properties.comment: The number of bytes for each vertex in this buffer

properties.name: usage
properties.comment: The usage hint for this buffer

methods.name: _computeLength
methods.comment: Compute the number of vertices in the buffer data

methods.name: attrib
methods.comment:
Add attribute declaration for this buffer. Once the attributes declared, the buffer can be linked to
the programs attributes using [attribPointer](#item-38)

params.name: name
params.comment: The name of the program's attribute

params.name: size
params.comment: The size of the attribute (`1` for a number, `2` for a vec2, etc.)

params.name: type
params.comment: The type of data (`GL_FLOAT`, `GL_SHORT`, etc.)

params.name: normalize
params.comment: Indicate if the data must be normalized

methods.name: attribPointer
methods.comment:
Link the given program attributes to this buffer. You should first declare attributes using [attrib](#item-25)
before calling this method.

params.name: program
params.comment: The program to link

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the underlying webgl buffer.

methods.name: data
methods.comment: Fill the webgl buffer with the given data. You can also pass a number instead to allocate the buffer to a given size.

params.name: array
params.comment: The data to use, or a size

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this BaseBuffer.

methods.name: draw
methods.comment: Shortcut to gl.drawArrays

params.name: mode
params.comment: The type of primitive to draw (`GL_TRIANGLE`, `GL_POINTS` etc)

params.name: count
params.comment: The number of vertices to draw (the full buffer is used if omited)

params.name: offset
params.comment: The position of the first vertex to draw

methods.name: subData
methods.comment: Set part of the buffer with the given data, starting at an offset.

params.name: array
params.comment: The data to use

params.name: offset
params.comment: The offset (in bytes) where the data should start to be written

classes.name: BaseBuffer
classes.comment: This class is the base for all buffer classes.

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the underlying webgl buffer.

methods.name: data
methods.comment: Fill the webgl buffer with the given data. You can also pass a number instead to allocate the buffer to a given size.

params.name: array
params.comment: The data to use, or a size

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this BaseBuffer.

methods.name: draw
methods.comment: Shortcut to `gl.drawArrays`

params.name: mode
params.comment: The type of primitive to draw (`GL_TRIANGLE`, `GL_POINTS` etc)

params.name: count
params.comment: The number of elements to draw (the full buffer is used if omited)

params.name: offset
params.comment: The position in the buffer to start from

methods.name: drawLineLoop
methods.comment: Shortcut to `gl.drawArrays(gl.LINE_LOOP, offset, count)`

params.name: count
params.comment: The number of elements to draw (the full buffer is used if omited)

params.name: offset
params.comment: The position in the buffer to start from

methods.name: drawLineStrip
methods.comment: Shortcut to `gl.drawArrays(gl.LINE_STRIP, offset, count)`

params.name: count
params.comment: The number of elements to draw (the full buffer is used if omited)

params.name: offset
params.comment: The position in the buffer to start from

methods.name: drawLines
methods.comment: Shortcut to `gl.drawArrays(gl.LINES, offset, count)`

params.name: count
params.comment: The number of elements to draw (the full buffer is used if omited)

params.name: offset
params.comment: The position in the buffer to start from

methods.name: drawPoints
methods.comment: Shortcut to `gl.drawArrays(gl.POINTS, offset, count)`

params.name: count
params.comment: The number of elements to draw (the full buffer is used if omited)

params.name: offset
params.comment: The position in the buffer to start from

methods.name: drawTriangleFan
methods.comment: Shortcut to `gl.drawArrays(gl.TRIANGLE_FAN, offset, count)`

params.name: count
params.comment: The number of elements to draw (the full buffer is used if omited)

params.name: offset
params.comment: The position in the buffer to start from

methods.name: drawTriangleStrip
methods.comment: Shortcut to `gl.drawArrays(gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP, offset, count)`

params.name: count
params.comment: The number of elements to draw (the full buffer is used if omited)

params.name: offset
params.comment: The position in the buffer to start from

methods.name: drawTriangles

params.name: count
params.comment: The number of elements to draw (the full buffer is used if omited)

params.name: offset
params.comment: The position in the buffer to start from

methods.name: subData
methods.comment: Set part of the buffer with the given data, starting at an offset.

params.name: array
params.comment: The data to use

params.name: offset

params.name: target
params.comment: The texture or renderbuffer to attach

properties.name: _isTexture
properties.comment: Whether the attachment target is a texture or not

properties.name: level
properties.comment: The mipmap level of the target texture (must be `0`)

properties.name: target
properties.comment: The target (texture or renderbuffer) of this attachment

methods.name: _attach
methods.comment:
Attach the target to the FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

methods.name: _detach
methods.comment:
Detach the target from the FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

methods.name: _resize
methods.comment: Resize the attachment target.

params.name: w
params.comment: The new width

params.name: h
params.comment: The new height

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this Attachment.

methods.name: isTexture
methods.comment:
Getter for the `_isTexture` property.
Know whether the attachment target is a texture or not.

classes.name: Fbo
classes.comment: This class manages framebuffers and their attachments.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this FBO belongs to

properties.name: attachments
properties.comment: The list of the bindingPoint/attachment pairs setup for this FBO

properties.name: attachmentsList
properties.comment: The list of the attachments setup for this FBO

properties.name: fbo
properties.comment: The underlying webgl framebuffer

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this FBO belongs to

properties.name: height
properties.comment: The height of this FBO

properties.name: width
properties.comment: The width of this FBO

methods.name: _allocate
methods.comment: Resize all attachments to the FBO size.

methods.name: attach
methods.comment:
Add an attachment to this FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

params.name: res
params.comment: The texture or buffer to attach

methods.name: attachColor
methods.comment:
Attach a texture to the color attachment 0 of this FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: format
params.comment: The pixel format of the texture (`GL_RGB`, `GL_RGBA`, etc.)

params.name: type
params.comment: The pixel data type of the texture (`GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`, `GL_FLOAT`, etc.)

params.name: internal
params.comment: The pixel internal format of the texture, defaults to the `format` parameter value

methods.name: attachDepth
methods.comment:
Attach a renderbuffer/texture to the depth/stencil attachment of this FBO.
 The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: depth
params.comment: Add depth component or not

params.name: stencil
params.comment: Add stencil component or not

params.name: useTexture
params.comment: Use a Texture2D instead of a RenderBuffer. If true, the depth param must also be true. You also must ensure Depth Texture capability is available on your context.

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the underlying webgl framebuffer.

methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Clear all buffers (color, depth and stencil).

methods.name: defaultViewport
methods.comment: Set the webgl viewport to the size of this FBO.

methods.name: detach
methods.comment:
Remove an attachment from this FBO.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this FBO.

methods.name: getAttachment
methods.comment: Get a specific attachment of this FBO (if it exists)

params.name: bindingPoint
params.comment: The binding point of the attachment (`GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0`, `GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT`, etc.)

methods.name: getColor
methods.comment: Get the color attachment of this FBO (if it exists)

params.name: index
params.comment: The color attachment index

methods.name: getColorTexture
methods.comment: Get the color texture of this FBO (if it exists)

params.name: index
params.comment: The color attachment index

methods.name: getDepth
methods.comment: Get the depth attachment of this FBO (if it exists)

methods.name: isValid
methods.comment:
Check if the FBO is valid.
The FBO must be explicitely bound before calling this method.

methods.name: resize
methods.comment: Resize the FBO and its attachments.

params.name: w
params.comment: The new width

params.name: h
params.comment: The new height

params.name: usage

properties.name: typeSize

params.comment: The position of the first index to draw

methods.name: setType
methods.comment: Change the internal type of the index data of the IndexBuffer

classes.name: Program
classes.comment:
This class provides provides shader compilation and webgl program linking functionality.
It also give you convenient access to active uniforms and attributes.

constructors.name: Program
constructors.comment: You can pass optional shader code to immediatly compile shaders or compile them later with [compile](#item-286).

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this Program belongs to

params.name: vert
params.comment: The vertex shader code

params.name: frag
params.comment: The fragment shader code

params.name: defs
params.comment: A string to prepend to both fragment and vertex shader code

properties.name: _cuid
properties.comment: Unique id for the program that updates every time it is compiled

properties.name: _uid
properties.comment: Unique id for the program

properties.name: dyns
properties.comment: The list of uniform & attribute names

properties.name: fShader
properties.comment: The underlying webgl fragment shader

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this Program belongs to

properties.name: program
properties.comment: The underlying webgl program

properties.name: ready
properties.comment: Whether the program is ready to use or not

properties.name: vShader
properties.comment: The underlying webgl vertex shader

properties.name: debug
properties.comment: Can be set to true to check and log compilation and linking errors

methods.name: _grabParameters
methods.comment: List all uniforms and attributes and create a helper function for each on Program instance.
methods.example:
For a uniform
```js
uniform vec3 uDirection;
```
it creates a method
```js
program.uDirection(1, 0, 0);
```

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Alias for [use](#item-282)

methods.name: compile
methods.comment:
Compile vertex and fragment shader, then link webgl program.
This method can be safely called several times.

params.name: vert
params.comment: The vertex shader code

params.name: frag
params.comment: The fragment shader code

params.name: prefix
params.comment: A string to prepend to both fragment and vertex shader code

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this Program.

methods.name: use
methods.comment:
Bind the underlying webgl program.
Shortcut for `gl.useProgram()`.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this RenderBuffer belongs to

params.name: format
params.comment: The pixel internal format of the renderbuffer (`GL_RGB`, `GL_RGBA`, etc.)

params.name: samples
params.comment: The number of samples to be used for the renderbuffer storage (webgl2 only)

properties.name: _uid
properties.comment: Unique id for the RenderBuffer

properties.name: _valid
properties.comment: Whether the RenderBuffer is valid or not

properties.name: format
properties.comment: The pixel internal format of the renderbuffer

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this RenderBuffer belongs to

properties.name: height
properties.comment: The height of the renderbuffer

properties.name: id
properties.comment: The underlying webgl renderbuffer

properties.name: samples
properties.comment: The number of samples used for the renderbuffer storage (webgl2 only)

properties.name: width
properties.comment: The width of the renderbuffer

methods.name: _storage
methods.comment: Allocate webgl renderbuffer with current parameters.

methods.name: allocate
methods.comment:
Check renderbuffer for validity and allocate it if invalid.
This method may leave RENDERBUFFER binding point empty.

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the underlying webgl renderbuffer.

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this RenderBuffer.

methods.name: resize
methods.comment: Resize the RenderBuffer.

params.name: w
params.comment: The new width

params.name: h
params.comment: The new height

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl2 context this Sampler belongs to

properties.name: _uid
properties.comment: Unique id for the Sampler

properties.name: gl
properties.comment: The webgl context this Sampler belongs to

properties.name: id
properties.comment: The underlying webgl sampler

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the underlying webgl sampler.

params.name: unit
params.comment: The texture unit to make active before binding

methods.name: clamp
methods.comment:
Make sampler clamp :
Set the `WRAP_S` and `WRAP_T` properties to `GL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE`.

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Delete all webgl objects related to this Sampler.

methods.name: mirror
methods.comment:
Make sampler mirror :
Set the `WRAP_S` and `WRAP_T` properties to `GL_MIRRORED_REPEAT`.

methods.name: repeat
methods.comment:
Make sampler repeat :
Set the `WRAP_S` and `WRAP_T` properties to `GL_REPEAT`.

methods.name: setFilter
methods.comment: Change the filtering parameters

params.name: smooth
params.comment: Use linear filtering or not

params.name: mipmap
params.comment: Enable mipmapping or not

params.name: miplinear
params.comment: Use linear mipmapping or not

methods.name: wrap
methods.comment: Set the `WRAP_S` and `WRAP_T` properties to the given value.

params.name: wrap
params.comment: The wrap value to use (`GL_REPEAT`, `GL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE`, etc.)

classes.name: Texture2D
classes.comment: This class manages TEXTURE_2D type textures.

params.name: gl
params.comment: The webgl context this Texture belongs to

params.name: format
params.comment: The pixel format of the texture (`GL_RGB`, `GL_RGBA`, etc.)

params.name: type
params.comment: The pixel data type of the texture (`GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`, `GL_FLOAT`, etc.)

params.name: internal
params.comment: The pixel internal format of the texture, defaults to the `format` parameter value

properties.name: _target
properties.comment: The binding point for this Texture

properties.name: textureType
properties.comment: The type of webgl texture (`TEXTURE_2D`, `TEXTURE_CUBE`, etc)

methods.name: fromData
methods.comment:
Set the texture data from a TypedArray.
You can also allocate an empty texture by providing only the size.

params.name: width
params.comment: The width of the texture

params.name: height
params.comment: The height of the texture

params.name: data
params.comment: The data to fill the texture with, or null to allocate an empty texture

methods.name: fromImage
methods.comment: Set the texture data from an HTML source.

params.name: img
params.comment: The HTML image, canvas or video element to use as source

functions.name: isWebgl2
functions.comment: Know whether the webgl context is webgl2 or not.

params.name: context
params.comment: The webgl context to test

functions.name: getComponentSize
functions.comment: Get the component size in bytes from a data type.

params.name: type
params.comment: The type of data (`GL_FLOAT`, `GL_SHORT`, etc.)

functions.name: getTextureFiltering
functions.comment:
Compute texture filtering enum from parameters.
Will return one of the following :
- `NEAREST`
- `LINEAR`
- `NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST`
- `LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST`
- `NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR`
- `LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR`

params.name: smooth
params.comment: Use linear filtering or not

params.name: mipmap
params.comment: Enable mipmapping or not

params.name: miplinear
params.comment: Use linear mipmapping or not

functions.name: isBufferSource
functions.comment:
Know whether the value is a buffer source or not.
You can use it for values that can be either a size or a buffer source.

params.name: val
params.comment: The value to test

libs.name: nanogl-node
libs.description: Handle nested objects transform in 3D space

classes.name: Node
classes.comment: This is the base class for all 3D objects. It's like a simplified equivalent to Object3D for threejs.

properties.name: position
properties.comment: Node's local position.

properties.name: rotation
properties.comment: Node's local rotation.

properties.name: scale
properties.comment: Node's local scale.

methods.name: add
methods.comment: Add child to this node. If child already has a parent, it will be removed as a node can only have one parent.

params.name: child
params.comment: Node to add as this node's child.

methods.name: invalidate
methods.comment: Invalidate this node's local matrix and world matrix.

methods.name: lookAt
methods.comment: Rotate node to look at target position.

params.name: tgt
params.comment: Target position to look at.

methods.name: remove
methods.comment: Remove child from this node's children.

params.name: child
params.comment: Node to remove from this node's children.

methods.name: rotateX
methods.comment: Rotate node around X-axis.

params.name: rad
params.comment: Rotation angle in radians.

methods.name: rotateY
methods.comment: Rotate node around Y-axis.

params.name: rad
params.comment: Rotation angle in radians.

methods.name: rotateZ
methods.comment: Rotate node around Z-axis.

params.name: rad
params.comment: Rotation angle in radians.

methods.name: setMatrix
methods.comment: Set node transformation matrix.

params.name: m4
params.comment: Matrix to assign to node.

methods.name: setScale
methods.comment: Set node scale for all axis.

params.name: s
params.comment: Scale factor.

methods.name: updateMatrix
methods.comment: Update node's local matrix, if it has been declared invalid.

methods.name: updateWorldMatrix
methods.comment: Update node's world matrix if it has been declared invalid, and recursively update all children's world matrices.

params.name: skipParents
params.comment: If true, parent's world matrix will not be updated.

functions.name: decomposeMat4
functions.comment: Retrieve position, rotation and scale from a given 4*4 matrix.

params.name: m4
params.comment: 4*4 matrix to decompose.

params.name: p
params.comment: Position vector.

params.name: q
params.comment: Rotation quaternion.

params.name: s
params.comment: Scale vector.

methods.name: render
methods.comment: Render the circle

methods.name: render
methods.comment: Render the outlined circle

methods.name: render
methods.comment: Render the rectangle

methods.name: render
methods.comment: Render the outlined rectangle

libs.name: nanogl-pbr
libs.description: Physically based rendering materials for nanogl

methods.name: add
methods.comment: Called by Chunks to add code to shader slots

params.name: slotId
params.comment: the slot where code will be insterted

params.name: code
params.comment: the glsl code to inject

methods.name: merge
methods.comment: merge all Hashed code from another ChunkSlots into this one

methods.name: _genCode
methods.comment:
new Enum( 'MyEnum', ['A', 'B', 'C'] )

#define A 1
#define B 2
#define C 3
#define VAL_MyEnum A
#define MyEnum(k) VAL_MyEnum == k

setter.name: set colorspace
setter.comment:
The colorspace of the input's value as is should be decoded.
To set the actual value in textures, set the colorspace property of the attached sampler

methods.name: projectionFromBounds
methods.comment:
Adjust the camera's projection of the light's shadowmap
to fit the given bounds

properties.name: ambiantIntensity
properties.comment: intensity of the SH part

properties.name: boxProjectionOffset
properties.comment: offset the center of the projection relative to the world space position of the light's node

properties.name: boxProjectionSize
properties.comment: The size of the box projection

properties.name: enableBoxProjection
properties.comment: enable box projection for reflection

properties.name: enableRotation
properties.comment: enable rotation of the IBL

properties.name: hdrEncoding
properties.comment: Encoding used to storee HDR values in the env map

properties.name: iblFormat
properties.comment: The type of Mapping of the env map

properties.name: intensity
properties.comment: global intensity of the ibl

properties.name: mipLevels
properties.comment:
number of available mip levels in the env map
In pmrem, the lower mip levels can be left unused (black) to keep definition in high roughness values

properties.name: specularIntensity
properties.comment: intensity of environement reflections

methods.name: getShadowmap
methods.comment:
return fbo color if depth_texture is not supported
otherwise return depth texture
return null if light don't cast shadows

methods.name: hasDepthShadowmap
methods.comment: return true if shadowmap support depth texture

methods.name: projectionFromBounds
methods.comment:
Adjust the camera's projection of the light's shadowmap
to fit the given bounds

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment:
release this instance and its reference in gl context
release all extensions

methods.name: getRenderableFormat
methods.comment: return the first color-renderable format or null if no one is.

params.name: configs
params.comment:
Array of object in the form {format,type,internal}
/!\ can leave unbinded framebuffer

methods.name: hasDepthTexture
methods.comment: return true if Texture with depth pixel format can be created.

methods.name: isAvailable
methods.comment: test if texture allocation with given pf leave gl error

methods.name: isRenderable
methods.comment:
Test if given format is color renderable
Actually est if FBO with given color format is "FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE"
/!\ can change bound framebuffer and tex

properties.name: _headPos
properties.comment: position in teh stack of the last "commit"

properties.name: _ptr
properties.comment: current positionin the stack

properties.name: _sets
properties.comment: bitmask set of all the configs in the stack

properties.name: _size
properties.comment: allocated size of the stack

properties.name: _stack
properties.comment: values of the states at each position in the stack

methods.name: commit
methods.comment: copy current stack state to the given patch config and mark HEAD as the current position

methods.name: copyConfig
methods.comment: Copy a row in the stack and sets to the given config

params.name: at
params.comment: position in the stack to copy from

params.name: cfg
params.comment: config to copy to

methods.name: initFromGL
methods.comment: Fetch state from gl context and set initial set and dat

methods.name: pop
methods.comment:
remove the last config from the stack
if the HEAD position is ahead the new position, the new position set is unioned with the previous set

methods.name: push
methods.comment: Add a config to the stack

params.name: cfg
params.comment:
A, B, C, D, E, F, G   -- previous row in _stack
1, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0   -- previous row in _sets

?, ?, X, D, E, ?, ?   -- cfg _dat
0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0   -- cfg _set

A, B, X, D, E, F, G   -- new row in _stack
1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0   -- new row in _sets

methods.name: clientWaitSync
methods.comment: equivalent to gl.clientWaitSync. Sync must be "insert" before calling this, otherwise return GL_WAIT_FAILED.

methods.name: insert
methods.comment: actually create a the WebGLSync and insert fence command in the GL command stream

methods.name: isSignaled
methods.comment: return true if the GL_SYNC_STATUS is GL_SIGNALED

methods.name: then
methods.comment: shortcut to this.promise.then

methods.name: bind
methods.comment: Bind the VAO. Call this method before each draw call

methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: release the internal webgl vao

methods.name: setup
methods.comment: Initialize attrib pointer setup for given program and arraybuffers

params.name: prg
params.comment: the nanogl Program

params.name: buffers
params.comment: an array of ArrayBuffers containing the attributes

methods.name: unbind
methods.comment: Unbind the VAO. Call this method after each draw call
